newsitem.title: UK: Price war fears hit UK mobile operators.
newsitem.headline: Price war fears hit UK mobile operators.

text.p: Fears of a price war among mobile telephone companies hit shares after operator One 2 One highlighted fierce competition in the market with new tariff deals, analysts said on Friday.
"One 2 One's price changes have focussed attention on price cuts this year," said one analyst, who declined to be named.
Vodafone Group Plc, Britain's biggest mobile telephone group, saw shares fall six pence to 267.5p and shares in Orange Plc, Britain's youngest carrier, slipped 5.5p to 207.5p by 1030 GMT.
The analyst said he believed One 2 One's four new packages, which were unveiled on Thursday, were not part of a new price war.
But he added: "There has been no major step change in prices since Orange rolled out close to national coverage."
One 2 One, Britain's smallest mobile operator, is playing catch-up hard and plans to have 95 percent coverage of the population by the end of this year.
Neither One 2 One, nor the second biggest cellular operator Cellnet are quoted.
